case_title: Mrs. ANIS HAIDER and others vs S. AMIR HAIDER and others

accussed_details.name: S. Amir Haider
allegation: Fraudulent claim of oral gift of property

accussed_details.name: Dr. S. Agha Haider
allegation: Fraudulent claim of oral gift of property

complaint_summary: The appellants challenged the decree dated 6-11-1979, alleging fraud and forgery in the oral gift of property claimed by their brothers, depriving them of their rightful Shari share.
investigation_summary: The trial court dismissed the application under section 12(2), C.P.C., without recording evidence. The Supreme Court remanded the case for proper adjudication and evidence collection.
judgment_summary: The Supreme Court remanded the case to the trial court, directing it to decide the application under section 12(2), C.P.C., after recording evidence from both parties within six months.
Decision_or_verdict: Case remanded to trial court for evidence collection and adjudication.
legal_arguments: Application under section 12(2), C.P.C. alleging fraud and forgery.
Improper application of Order VII, rule 11, C.P.C. by lower courts.
Requirement of evidence recording for serious allegations.
assets: Disputed property allegedly gifted orally to brothers.

witness_statement.Syed Afzal Haider: Filed written statement and earlier statement dated 1-7-1979 claiming oral gift of property.

key_issues: Improper dismissal of application under section 12(2), C.P.C.

legal_terms.Oral gift: A verbal transfer of property ownership without written documentation.

words_and_phrases.Rule of the Court: Judicial confirmation of an arbitrator's award.

summary_vector_notes: The case involves a property dispute between siblings over an alleged oral gift by their father. The appellants claim fraud and forgery in the proceedings, seeking their Shari share. The Supreme Court remanded the case for evidence collection and proper adjudication.
